titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William A. Speck Collection of Goetheana: Theater Ephemera
Speck (William A.) Collection of Goetheana: Theater Ephemera
titlestmt.author: by Susan Brady and Andrea Benefiel

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 27, 2019 at 03:04

did.unittitle: William A. Speck collection of Goetheana : theater ephemera

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Most of the material in the Speck Collection was assembled by William A. Speck. Much of the Faust material probably came from the Ehrhardt Collection, purchased by the library in 1922. Additional items have been added more recently by the library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The William A. Speck Collection of Goetheana: Theater Ephemera is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The William A. Speck Collection of Goetheana: Theater Ephemera. Yale Collection of German Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced primarily from information on the folders in which the material was formerly housed. All pertinent descriptive information has been retained, including photocopies of folder labels and see references on cards within the folders. "Speck numbers" formerly used to classify material have been replaced by standard box and folder references.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Associated Materials: William A. Speck Collection of Goetheana: Manuscripts (YCGL MSS 6), William A. Speck Collection of Goetheana: Music (YCGL MSS 9), and William A. Speck Collection of Prints (YCGL MSS 11), Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

bioghist.head: William A. Speck (1864-1928)
bioghist.p: William A. Speck, the son of German immigrants, was born in New York City in 1864. A pharmacist by profession, he amassed the largest Goethe collection outside of Germany. In 1913, he and his collection came from Haverstraw, New York to Yale, where he served as curator of the collection until his death in 1928. For further biographical information on William A. Speck and a general history and description of the Speck Collection, see the finding aid for the William A. Speck Collection of Goetheana: Manuscripts (YCGL MSS 6).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Performances of Goethe's Works and Other Productions Based on Them, circa 1725-1984. II. Performances of Plays and Operas by Other Writers, 1759-1929. III Additional Playbills, Programs, Posters, and Other Ephemera, 1806-1934.

controlaccess.subject: Magic shows -- Germany
Opera -- Germany
Puppet plays, German
Theater -- Germany
controlaccess.persname: Goethe, Johann Wolfgang von, 1749-1832 ( Faust, Musical settings)
Goethe, Johann Wolfgang von, 1749-1832 -- Stage history

did.unittitle: Performances of Goethe's Works and Other Productions Based on Them

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I. is organized into ten subseries: Faust in Europe without Music, Faust in Europe with Music, Faust in the United States, Operas Related to Faust , Faust by Others than Goethe, Faust as Burlesque, Magic Shows Related to Faust , Faust Puppet Plays, Works Based on Faust -Related Characters, and Goethe Works Other than Faust . Within each subseries material is arranged alphabetically by name of city, title of work, or creator of work.

did.unittitle: Berlin, Braunschweig, Breslau, Chemnitz, Coburg, Köln
London, Meiningen, München, Plauen, Prag, Stuttgart, Teplitz-Schönau
Performances in Connecticut, Illinois, Massachusetts, Michigan, New Jersey, Ohio, Utah, and Washington
Mephistopheles , by Arrige Boito, Doktor Faust , by Ferrucio Busoni
Faust, Faust und Margarethe, er Margarethe , by Charles Gounod
Don Juan , by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
Don Juan plays, Medea plays, Robert der Teufel , Christoph Wagner plays, Casperl plays, and Goethe groteske
Margarethl und Fäustling by Julius Hopp, Margarethe , and Dr. Faust's Zauberkäppchen
Der ewige Jude , Helena , Mephisto , and Tanzmärchen
Die erste Walpurgisnacht , Erwin und Elmire , Die Fischerin , Die Geschwister , and Goethe-Feier
"Goethe in fiction" (Goethe as a character in productions), Götz von Berlichingen , Harzreise im Winter , and Iphigenia
Das Jahrmarktfest von Plundersweilern , Jery und Bätely , Laune des Verliebten , Lieder und Balladen , Mignon , and Die Mitschuldigen
Die natürliche Tochter , Paläophron und Neoterpe , Pandora , Prometheus , Satyros , Stella , Torquato Tasso , Triumph der Empfindsamkeit , Was wir bringen , and Werther
Performances of Plays and Operas by Other Writers

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by name of author or composer.

did.unittitle: Byron, Borngräber, Giordano-Bruno, Fuchs, and Hauptmann
Hell, Herzer und Löhner, Hiller, Hirschfield, Hölz, Ibsen, and Iffland
Klinger, Kotzebue, Lenz, Lessing, Rousseau, Sachs, Schiller, Strindberg, Wagner, and anonymous authors
Additional Playbills, Programs, Posters and Other Ephemera

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is organized into three subseries: Lectures on Goethe, Miscellaneous Stage Productions, and Miscellaneous Puppet Plays. Lectures and Stage Production material is arranged alphabetically by the name of the city where presented; Puppet Play material is not arranged.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Paper and cardboard proscenium showing a scene from Faust, assembled from printed lithographic illustrations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Broadside Material consists of items from Series I through Series III as indicated in the above listing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original catalogue cards formerly served to provide access to the collection.
